intro: Neslia apiculata, commonly known as the slender neslia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers make it easily identifiable. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its delicate appearance.
